Title: SATS HLC Error detection
Description: The PowerShell script is scheduled to run at regular intervals, using the task scheduler or another scheduling tool.  The PowerShell script analyzes the results of the SQL query to detect HLC  ERRORS It may use conditional statements or data process techniques to identify errors based on specific criteria or patterns. If errors are detected, the PowerShell script automatically generates an email notification. The email contain details about the error found, such as error description, timestamps.
Problem it Solves: Issue:  Loss of synchronization with our sorters (COY/FLY). We've noticed that losing control of the sorter requires us to restart the HLC services to restore synchronization. Observation: Often before the synchronization loss, our logs show errors like "Communication error PLC – HLC. Solution: We have decided to implement a process to read the logs every 5 minutes and escalate if this type of message is detected.
Benefits: By automating this process with Powershell, you can effciently monitor synchronization status and ensure timely communication of errors, allowing for swift resolution and minimal disruption to the system.

Title: Certificate-less queries to ESP Customs services
Description: the idea is to have a single point of entry for such requests/queries with a central platform managing them and keeping the required logs. Certificates won´t be with end-users anymore but in the cloud within the PowerAutomate flows to be invoked by a simple PowerApp as SPOC, generating the logs needed to track its usage. Users granted will be managed by an Azure AD group to add/remove users to the application on-the-air.
Problem it Solves: there are a number of services published in the Spanish Customs website to query MAWB in summary declarations, ICS2 MRN, clearance MRN... through a Digital Certificate of Representation of the DHL business unit. As per CRISP mandate, the access has to be fully controlled which it is now done via AD groups, citrix edge shortcuts and proxy logs which becomes quite complex. On the other hand, there are multiple https links to browse through which makes something quite complex to be followed.
Benefits: CRISP controls better documented, SPOC for queries/request to the Spanish AEAT
Tags: certificate, crisp, M365, o365, pfx, powerapps, Powerautomate, PowerPlatform
